fields.description:
RTE is adding "\\" when in a table, on every subsequent save.

Steps
1)  Using the Rich text editor, Create a table, enter data with a hard return -
     ie.  Rob
           Testing
2) Save. - Display is fine.
3) Click Edit, then Save using the RTE - The single "\\" is now doubled on all cells.
4) Repeat Edit, Save, "\\" is now tripled.
5) Insert another row with data that includes a hard return.
6) Previous cells now have an additional "\\" - happens on every save. 

This issue seems to be related but independent of http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6633 and http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6633
fields.summary: Confluence adding characters to tables.

fields.description:
We've had a case where it seems that the axis webservice is being asked by confluence to transmit characters that are not valid in an XML response. (Bytes below 0x20 except for 0x9, 0xA and 0xD)

While the case in question makes it appears that control characters are making their way into the Confluence index that perhaps shouldn't, we probably should investigate make the webservice filter these characters appropriately so that RPC response don't fail entirely.

This is possible in Axis by providing a different XML character encoding strategy and configuring the library to use it.

I'd suggest looking at replacing these invalid code points with a question mark or similar.
fields.summary: Axis webservice may be asked to deliver invalid XML characters

fields.description: The code element is loosing it format, just as describe in Ticket CONF-4490.
fields.summary: Formatting lost with {code} element

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13282].
  {panel}

Regarding Confluence configuration at Administration -> General -> Security and privacy settings -> User email visibility 

It would increase privacy of users, if a supplementary option "show to logged-in users only" were available to restrict display of email addresses (masked or public, depending on the current setting) to users who are logged-in.

Maybe options regarding email addresses should be divided into a) how email addresses are displayed (clear, masked, scrambled, not), and b) to whom (everyone, administrators, users, a specific user group, none)

This should in particular work with external user management.

Thanks,
Torge

PS JIRA since version 3.2 has such an option?
fields.summary: Provide administrative option to show email addresses logged-in users only
Mail a Page of News

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13280].
  {panel}

When you access the following link:

* http://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/latest/

It redirects you to to Confluence 2.8.0 API, similar to:

* http://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/2.8.0/

Please update the link so that it redirects to Confluence 2.9.x API (or the latest available API).
fields.summary: Update Latest Confluence API to Confluence 2.9.x API

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13278]. {panel} The lines in footer.vmd that correspond to the powered by text at the footers should be notated in comments in the code so that users are more aware of stripping those lines out when making customisations. {code}
  • $action.getText('powered.by.atlassian.confluence',[$action.getText('url.atlassian.software.confluence.footer'), "$generalUtil.versionNumber","${generalUtil.buildNumber}", "${generalUtil.buildDateString}"])
  • $action.getText('printed.by.atlassian.confluence',["$generalUtil.versionNumber"])
  • $action.getText('bug.feature.request') –
  • $action.getText('footer.atlassian.news') –
  • $action.getText('contact.administrators')
{code}
fields.summary: Make more clear in footer.vm which lines cannot be altered

fields.description:
According to this document, http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Restoring+a+Deleted+Page, and every version of this document in past versions of Confluence:


bq. When you restore a page, you are retrieving it from 'Trash' to the same location in the space where it existed before it was deleted.


This is not the case.  When you restore a page, the page is restored to the root of the space, not to it's original location.  Example:  spaceroot > First > Second > Third.  If you delete Second and then restore, Second is now located at spaceroot > Second.

So have the docs been wrong/unclear all along or is the implementation wrong?
fields.summary: Restoring a Deleted Page

fields.description:
Even if I start Confluence with {{-Dconfluence.disable.peopledirectory.anonymous=true}}, it is still possible to browse individual users by visiting a URL like https://[wikiBaseUrl]/display/~[accountName].

This is a *major* security problem for us because it exposes:
1. The user's name
2. The user's ID
3. The user's email address

Evidence of the data leakage can be found by searching Google on the account name of people in the People Directory.

Because of this problem, we had to disable all anonymous access to our system, and I am dealing with fallout from reduced institutional confidence in Atlassian Confluence.

"Best security practices" should require this information not be made available anonymously without a sysadmin override.

Also, it should also be easier for administrators to restrict access than by hacking the registry (for Windows Service-based installs) or modifying setenv.bat.

I set priority to "critical" because:
A. This has negatively impacted our use of Atlassian. I had to disable anonymous view privileges on wiki spaces that we needed to be exposed to the world (like our Help Desk wiki space).
B. This is a security hole.
fields.summary: Restrict anonymous users from viewing user profiles.

fields.description:
After fixing [CONF-13024] we ended up with the original slow start up time. Now it takes about 120sec for confluence startup in a debug mode using tomcat, it is said to be even slower on resin (up to 5 min). We want to improve the start up time..

The original investigation showed that the reason for the poor performance is aspectJ caching of context classloader before we correctly set it to a PluginClassloader. Possible solution can be patching aspectJ not to cache classloader.
fields.summary: Fix slow start-up caused by AspectJ hitting the plugin classloader too often

Users wlll find this confusing, I guess.

fields.description:
Confluence's classic, leftnav and potentially myriad other themes not loading javascript and css resources.

-This is because the main.vmd decorators in these themes make a call to the #standardHeader() velocity macro which in turn calls $webResourceManager.getResources().  However (atleast in confluence 2.9 which shipped with atlassian-plugins2.0.0beta6.2.jar) the getResources() method is no longer part of the WebResourcesManager class.  This results in these themes not loading many resources required by confluence.-


I take it back -- further investigation reveals this to be untrue.  I'm closing this but out.
fields.summary: $webResourceManager.getResources() call from header.vm is broken

fields.description:
All editing was done in Markup mode, not Rich Text mode.

Whenever I paste Unicode characters (e.g. █ Full Block, aka U+2588) in the middle of an escaped HTML table and save, the table and the Unicode characters render correctly in the page immediately after the Edit is complete.
However, whenever I reload that same page, the Unicode characters have been replaced by other characters.  (e.g. the Full Block is always replaced by the Inverted Question Mark ¿ aka U+00BF / Alt+0191)

On re-editing to replace the Inverted Question Marks with Full Blocks, the same behavior happens again: the page renders correctly immediately after the editing is done, but reloading the page replaces the Full Blocks with Inverted Question Marks again.
fields.summary: Special characters entered in Markup mode show correctly right after editing, but show incorrectly on later load.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13259].
  {panel}

Add an access control for spaces that controls if its contents can show up in search results.
If a user has search rights but no view rights to the space it's contents can show up in search results, but the resulting documents will not be viewable.
If a user has search and view rights to the space it's contents can show up in search results, and the resulting documents will be viewable.
View rights by default will indicate that the user has search rights.
If a user has not search rights and no view rights the contents cannot show up in a search result.
fields.summary: Add Space Search Access Control

fields.description:
Watched page list tab under preferences shows pages the user can't view.

The list should filter out pages a user cant see anymore.

Steps to replicate:
# Log in as a normal *confluence-users* group member
# Watch a page
# Get other user to edit the watched page and restrict viewing to themselves
# The original watcher would still be able to see the restricted page listed in http://yourdomainhere.com/users/viewnotifications.action

The restricted page won't be accessible to the watcher and the watcher won't receive email updates from the page either.

fields.description:
Lists (bullet points or numbered):  Highlight an individual word, and select the formatting as Code.  Only the highlighted word will be changed - the text before and after the highlighted word remains as it was.  This is what I would expect.

Paragraphs:  Highlight an individual word, and select the formatting as Code.  The entire paragraph will be formatted, not just the highlighted word.

The behaviour should be consistent.  I think that applying the formatting only to the highlighted text is most intuitive.
fields.summary: Formatting text in lists is inconsistent with formatting paragraph text

fields.description:
Use a thread-local per-request cache to cache:

* User + permission + space = true/false at the SpacePermissionManager level
* user has useConfluence permission at the PermissionManager level

This should remove a significant number of duplicated permission checks per request, hopefully helping performance on systems with unusual user management setups. It's unlikely to have a gigantic effect on systems with small numbers of users/groups/spaces, though.
fields.summary: Improve performance by creating a threadlocal cache for space permission checks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13228].
  {panel}

The Confluence web interface for its page breadcrumb can be improved. 

When opening a page with a long breadcrumb (for example on a laptop monitor or small monitor) the breadcrumb section will be dynamically arranged (a scroll bar will appear and the breadcrumb items will be moved down). 

Perhaps instead of using a scrollbar (not pretty) we can truncate the breadcrumbs with a '...'

Steps to replicate:
# Open a page with long breadcrumb link, for example: http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/D
# Minimise the browser, keep minimising the window until you see the page breadcrumb is dynamically arranged.
# You will then see the breadcrumb items moved downwards and a scrollbar will appear.
fields.summary: Improve Confluence bread crumb resizing

fields.description:

This gets very irritating when using the full screen a lot - it would be much more user-friendly if the full screen mode also had the Save and Cancel buttons available.
fields.summary: User should not have to exit full screen mode in RTE when editing a page

fields.description: When editing a page, the default text colour is black.  Yet the colour picker default is grey.  This is inconsistent - the colour picker default should be the same as the text default - i.e. black.

fields.description:
This is due to a wrong query in Space.hbm.xml. The query for users which are a member of at least one group are correct, whereas the query for users which are not a member of any group doesn't include anonymous space permissions.
The problem probably wasn't discovered earlier because users which are not a member of any group are a rare case.
fields.summary: Users which are not a member of any group can't access spaces permitted for anonymous users

fields.description:
When looking at a blogpost, I decided to create a new page. I  cancelled a page creation, and then I got to a 404 page.

When cancelling a blogpost creation i end up in the alphabetical page list, which is bad considering that this a) is being considered for removal, and b) know to be an expensive operation, and c) makes no sense in the first place.
fields.summary: Cancelling content-creation partially broken and inconsistent

fields.description: This is caused by the hibernate query cache not being flushed properly. This is due to the fact we are still using SQL (instead of HQL) for some of the label queries. SQL queries aren't handled very well by hibernate regarding query caching, because hibernate is unable to detect which tables are involved in a query. The solution is to use HQL which enables hibernate to properly track which tables were used.

Thanks,
Jim

fields.description:
When a wiki space that contains multiple continuous blank lines is opened for editing in Rich Text mode and saved with no changes made -- confluence  deletes the multiple blank lines irrespective of user intentions (and the same is reported by the "view changes" functionality).

The same does not happen in Wiki Markup mode (blank lines including multiple contigous blank lines are preserved as entered).

All edit modes should behave consistently -- either delete multiple blank lines or preserve multiple blank lines (I vote preserve).

fields.description:
We are interested in approving comments, like this, rather than page edits.

*Storytelling...*
Our campus IT department uses Confluence to identify needs, assess resources, gather functional requirements and communicate during development/implmentation. In order to get input from as many potential users, both those we know about with Confluence ID's and those we may not know about (who by the way always have the best issues to contribute), we leave Confluence open for anonymous commenting (not editing). Each day Confluence pushes out daily reports to the campus were folks can see the current issues under discussion, development and deployment. If they see something that they may have an affinity for, or expertise in, they go to the page and comment on the subject. Project managers are then required to answer the question or embed the issue directly into the body of the Confluence page. The test for addressing the point raised is, "if the person came back to the page, would they ask the same question?"

Unfortunately, even with CAPTCHA on, some bad posts are from humans (students can also participate). We have received several rude or offensive posts and even some from vendors who are promoting, rather than collaborating.

The result is that a few folks want to turn off anonymous comments due to obscenity concerns.

*Use Case...*
An anonymous user finds a page of interest and would like to contribute an idea. They click on the "Add Comment" button, the comment form appears, and enter their comment through the RTE or Wiki markup form. After placing their comment, they can enter their email address to be notified when the comment is approved and posted and receive notifications of follow-ups. They click "Post" and the browser screen updates notifying the anonymous user that their comments have been submitted to the "page's owner."

Once an anonymous comment is submitted, an email is sent to the "page's owner" (the page's owner would be the person who originally created the page by default or defined later by the original author), with a copy of the comment, an indication of which page was commented on, a place for a response to the comment (if an email was given) and an "Approve" "Deny" option.

If the page owner approves the comment, it is posted just like normal user comments.

If the page is denied, an email is sent back to the anonymous commenter telling them they were denied and, if a response was included, why.
fields.summary: Comments Approval Workflow

fields.description:
Inserting a link to the space description via _(Space Admin-> Edit Space Details->Insert Link)_ somehow shows as text in Dashboard instead of a link.

Steps to reproduce the problem:

# Browse Space
# Go to {{Space Admin-> Edit Space Details}}
# Clicking {{Insert Link}}
# Select a link of the current space
# A link like [myspace:My Page] is inserted in the description of the space

In dashboard, you should be able to see the space description with text instead of a link. The space description should show link in this case.
fields.summary: Space description does not work properly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13197].
  {panel}

Would not it be wonderful if we had a single point of access of Administering multiple Confluence upgrades, plugin installs etc...

For example this 'Application Manager' would be able to retrieve a plugin from a Plugin Repo and then by {{deploy}} command would deploy it to all (or selected) confluence instances. Similarly, one could disable all plugins from this single point access. 

Clearly, there is _endless_ options for managing the application {{r e m o t e l y}} (if you want to call that)

Could be useful for large deployments .... and am not saying that architecture wise or implementation wise this is an easy task !!! Not at all :-) Yet think of the potential possibilities .....
fields.summary: Deployment and Upgrade manager for multiple instances

fields.description:
In large enterprises, users can belong to a large number of groups.
Our LDAP bind account has a partial view on the LDAP: it cannot see al the groups in the LDAP, only a potion of the groups (but all the groups that are Confluence related).
When a member belongs to groups that Confluence cannot access, Confluence often logs the following line:
[atlassian.confluence.security.DefaultSpacePermissionManager] hasPermissionViaGroups null group returned by class $Proxy384
When we display the groups of a user (in the user profile, for instance), each acessible group is normally displayed, and each group Confluence can't access is displayed as an already displayed group.
For instance, the following groups are displayed:
H310-WikiTest-Members 
H310-Service1-Administrators 
H310-SubContractors 
H310-SubContractors 
H310-SubContractors 
test-coordinator 
when the user is member of H310-WikiTest-Members , H310-Service1-Administrators, H310-SubContractors, test-coordinator (all these are accessible), plus two groups that Confluence can't access.
When we try to access the 'Edit Group' functionality in the 'Manage Users' functionality, we have the following stack trace:

fields.description:
Confluence is not able to store a page containing a long text link and ended with character (:) and when it is using postgreSQL. The steps to reproduce:
# Create a new fresh Confluence instance.
# Create a page containing the following text:
{noformat}
\[abc \\ 1234567890123456789012345678901234567890 \\ 1234567890123456789012345678901234567890 \\ 1234567890123456789012345678901234567890 \\ 1234567890123456789012345678901234567890 \\ 1234567890123456789012345678901234567890 \\ 1234567890123456789012345678901234567890:\] 
{noformat}
# Save the page
fields.summary: Cannot store a page containing a long link and ended with character : when it is using postgreSQL

fields.description:
Confluence is not able to store a page containing a long link. The steps to reproduce:
# Create Confluence instance using postgreSQL as its database.
# Put the following content:
{noformat}
\[abc
1234567890123456789012345678901234567890
ddd
1234567890123456789012345678901234567890
1234567890123456789012345678901234567890
1234567890123456789012345678901234567890
1234567890123456789012345678901234567890
1234567890123456789012345678901234567890slllllxcvcvs:\]
{noformat}
# Save the page.
fields.summary: Maximum length of links is not enforced except at database level, leading to nasty stacktraces

fields.description:
I have verified this issue by:

# Create a space
# Create a page
# Create three attachments on this page (note there are no links to these attachments)
## {{test.txt}}
## {{test test.txt}} (note the space)
## {{test(test).txt}}
# Export the space to HTML
# Extracted the ZIP to a local folder

I can see that the ZIP does not include all three attachments, it only includes the attachment that does not have the space or brackets.

{noformat}
Archive:  TST-20081015-10_00_14-0.zip
  inflating: TST/index.html          
  inflating: TST/Home.html           
  inflating: TST/download/attachments/1015810/test.txt  
  inflating: TST/images/icons/home_16.gif  
  inflating: TST/images/icons/bullet_blue.gif  
  inflating: TST/images/border/spacer.gif  
  inflating: TST/styles/site.css 
{noformat}
fields.summary: Attachments with space(s) in the filename are not exported when exporting a space to HTML

Allow the raw map of parameters to be available in the velocity context

fields.description: If you add a pagetree macro to use for space navigation, use of pagetree macros anywhere else in the space will break.  For example, I have a page that uses a pagetree macro to show snippets of pages below it.  When this page is viewed all it shows is 'Loading' on IE/Firefox.  The left hand navigation view works OK however.
fields.summary: pagetree macro navigation on space does not allow pagetree on individual pages

fields.description:
Hi,

The spacing on the column macro seems to have been removed in confluence 2.9.1

The affected css is wiki-content.css

The lines that are affected look like this

.wiki-content td.confluenceTd { padding-right: 10px; }
.wiki-content td.confluenceTd,
.wiki-content th.confluenceTh { margin: 0; padding: 0; }

Because the bottom line is below the top it is fact overwriting it and the right padding is lost.

Could you please look into this.

Regards,
Jason Hinch
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Column macro Spacing has changed in confluence 2.9.1

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13178].
  {panel}

I know that I can search a word in some specific space in Confluence.

However, sometimes I'd like to search a word in the subpages (children pages?) under some page.

That is to say, I'd like to restrict a search area to some page tree.

Please make this enable in Conflluence.

Please set a Google-like sophisticated flexible search functions in Confluence search box!!!
fields.summary: Search option which can look for words only in the subpages (children pages) under some page

fields.description:
Browsing Labels of a space with no labels you get:
No content in this space has been labelled.

You should get:
No content in this space has been labeled.
fields.summary: Spelling mistake on Browse Labels page

fields.description: We currently serve resources with cache control private which means that caching does not happen under https.
fields.summary: Improve https speed by adding Cache Control Public to the caching headers for resources

fields.description:
CONF-8585 states that we should use Saxon, but I think that issue may be misleading.

We already have Xalan as a dependency, and given the age of the version of Saxon we are using (and the fact more recent versions have dropped support for FOP) we should use Xalan for all XSLT operations.
fields.summary: Use Xalan for PDF generation instead of Saxon

fields.description:
Even if there are no pending johnson events left, the error page only displays a message that all problems have been resolved.

A better way to handle recovery from johnson events would be to use an internal servlet dispatcher forward for GET requests which will preserve the resource location for the browser. For all other request methods we redirect to the usual errors.jsp. But instead of just displaying a message, we now also provide a link to the homepage of the Confluence instance.
fields.summary: Error page for pending johnson events should preserve resource location

fields.description: If you convert a global space to a personal space, old labels are missing from the view.
fields.summary: Labels are lost when converting a global space to a personal space

fields.description:
All text areas are broken in the add comment section in the Left navigation theme 

Add page editors are fine.
fields.summary: Add comment box is broken in the Left Navigation Theme

fields.description: The list of languages on the language selection page shows a flag image.  The alt text for these images is being taken from the "current" language, so (in my case anyway) it was showing "English" for each flag.  Should be the name of each individual selection.
fields.summary: Language selection page uses incorrect ALT tag for flags

fields.description:
Some users need the ability to start off using the wiki by creating a personal space and then be able to promote that space to a global space for more users to use once the content in the space has matured and the user is also more comfortable to let other users begin using the space. 

Please provide a strategy/solution to accomplish this. I was able to find out documentation to convert a Global space to a personal space but did not find anything to convert a personal space to a global space.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 2nd November, 2010|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi All,
After some discussion we have come to the conclusion that we will not be implementing this feature. Although this isn't a complete workaround, users can move parent (and child pages) from one space to another. We can't see ourselves completing this feature in the foreseeable future and don't have plans to in our backlog. I'll be marking this issue as "Won't Fix".

We also [have partners that can help you customise Confluence|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APW/] that could help you with a one-off migration if needed.
Sherif Mansour
Confluence Product Management
{panel}
fields.summary: Convert a Personal Space to a Global Space
Dynamic linking to page/attachment versions

fields.description:
In Confluence in IE7 do the following:
1. Open a page for editing and select Wiki Markup.
2. Place the insertion point anywhere in the text (not at the end) and click either the Insert Image or Insert link button.
3. Insert an image/a link. The link text is not inserted at the insertion point, instead it is inserted at the end of the text in the edit window.
4. Cut/paste is required to get the link in the correct place.
fields.summary: Problems with linking in wiki markup in IE7

fields.description: Lucene serach index is NOT indexing words which occur in the 'change tracked' sections of a MS-Word document. 'Change tracking' is used to show text that are modified, deleted or added and many people use this feature in MS-Word to identify the changes in the document from previous version.
fields.summary: No search index created for words in 'Change Tracked' Parts of  Word Document

fields.description:
With the inclusion of the InsertImageInDraftAction we should include a security check for adding attachments to a draft. 

At the moment we don't make a permission check at all, and assume that users will not be able to see the file upload box if they don't have the required permissions.
fields.summary: AttachmentPermissionsDelegate does not include a permissions check for drafts

fields.description:
This is happening in Confluence 2.9.1, not sure if this is happening in older versions.

If I have the global theme set to Default Theme, http://localhost/dosearchsite.action works as it should when I do a search on {{test}}:
http://localhost/dosearchsite.action?queryString=test&where=conf_global&type=&lastModified=&contributor=&contributorUsername=

However, if the global theme is anything else (Left Navigation, Clickr or Confluence Classic), http://localhost/dosearchsite.action returns results with duplicate querystrings.  
Searching for {{test}} results in this: 
http://localhost/dosearchsite.action?queryString=test&queryString=test&where=conf_global&type=&lastModified=&contributor=&contributorUsername=
fields.summary: dosearchsite.action duplicates the querystring

fields.description: When you narrow your window width on the Space Admin: Permissions page, the help tips layer overwrites the permissions headers. CSS should be fixed to lock help tips at the right of the permissions rather than allow it to float over page content.
fields.summary: Help Tips layer overwrites permissions interface

fields.description:
the issue is minor for "alias of link properties"
and blocker for "tasklists"

When you select text with french caracters like:
- é
- è
- à
- ô
- ê

To make a link on it, in the alias of link properties they will be changed in other caracters, despite in the main editor these caracters are well supported and displayed.
If you put french caracters in tasklist, the tasklist doesn't work. 

For instance, try to make a link on:

é then è then à 

you'll get 

Ã© then Ã¨ then Ã 


and create a task "Acceptation d'un candidat ayant une réservation complémentaire (à compléter)"
fields.summary: French caracters not supported in: "alias of link properties" and text of tasks in "tasklists"

fields.description: When we use the {viewfile} macro to update an excel spreadsheet (which uses webdav), no notification takes place through the watch mechanism.
fields.summary: Attachments updated  via webdav bypass watch notification

fields.description:
This is seen in a call to renderPage where you get a response similar to -

{noformat}
<?xml version=\"1.0\"?>
<methodResponse>
	<params>
		<param>
			<value><div id=\"ConfluenceContent\"><h1><a name=\"TestBCDEFG-Here%27sanote\"></a>Here's a note</h1>
<p>My note</p>

<p><tt>notes</tt></p></div></value>
		</param>
	</params>
</methodResponse>
{noformat}

The {{<value>}} element above should have it's contents contained with in a {{<string>}} element.

I think this problem also happens in other places, in particular with numeric values (which should be contained in an {{<int>}} or a {{<double>}} element. I haven't tracked this down yet - I'll update the issue if I find out more.

See [the XML RPC spec|http://www.xmlrpc.com/spec] for more details.
fields.summary: XML response value elements do not always contain a required type child element

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13150].
  {panel}

Please make the count of results per page in the sitesearch (dosearchsite.action) easily configurable. The setting would be settable in the administration page at best. A special category "search-options" is of course preferred.

Yes, I know that it may be a performance problem when having lots of hits. Still I wonder why this has never been freely configurable... It seems hardcoded to 10 results somewhere.

Greetings,
Paul
fields.summary: Make count of results per page of pagination easily configurable
